balloonFlight.name: Balloon Flight
balloonFlight.description: Enjoy an unforgettable view of the canyons and landscape of Cambará do Sul on a sunrise balloon flight.
balloonFlight.details: A once-in-a-lifetime experience. The balloon flight over the serra cliffs offers a unique perspective of the Itaimbezinho and Fortaleza Canyons. The activity lasts about 1 hour and ends with a sparkling wine toast. Conducted by certified and experienced partners.

horseRiding.name: Horseback Riding
horseRiding.description: Explore exclusive trails and green fields on a relaxing horseback ride, connecting with local nature.
horseRiding.details: Our horseback rides are guided by a local gaucho and use criollo horses, gentle and adapted to the region. The rides vary from 1 to 4 hours, passing through fields, araucaria forests and streams. No previous experience necessary.

atvTour.name: ATV Tour
atvTour.description: Get ready for a unique and exciting experience! Our ATV tour combines adrenaline and nature in an unforgettable adventure that takes you to one of the most beautiful waterfalls in the region.
atvTour.details: During the route, you will cross stunning landscapes until reaching the final destination: a crystal-clear waterfall surrounded by lush vegetation, perfect for relaxing and connecting with nature. Includes: equipped ATV, safety equipment and experienced instructor.

tennisCourt.name: Tennis Court
tennisCourt.description: Challenge your friends to an exciting match on our tennis court, surrounded by the lush nature of Serra Gaúcha.
tennisCourt.details: Our tennis court is available to all guests. The natural setting provides a unique experience for playing sports. Schedule your time at reception.

lakeFishing.name: Lake for Fishing and Pedal Boat
lakeFishing.description: Relax with sport fishing in our serene lake or have fun on a pedal boat ride with the family.
lakeFishing.details: The lake is the heart of our inn. We offer rods and bait for sport fishing (catch and release) of species like tilapia and carp. The swan-shaped pedal boat is an attraction for children and couples. Life jackets are provided.

gameRoom.name: Game Room
gameRoom.description: Fun guaranteed for all ages with pool and foosball in our cozy game room.
gameRoom.details: Our game room is the perfect meeting point for rainy days or evening leisure. It features a professional pool table, foosball, and a selection of board games for the whole family.

bochaField.name: Bocce Ball Court
bochaField.description: Enjoy a traditional and relaxed game of bocce ball on our professional court, a perfect afternoon pastime.
bochaField.details: Revive the Italian tradition with a game of bocce ball on our official court. It's a sport that unites generations and guarantees good laughs. The rules are posted next to the court for those who want to learn.

bbqArea.name: BBQ Area
bbqArea.description: Gather your friends and family for an authentic gaucho barbecue in our equipped and cozy space.
bbqArea.details: A rustic kiosk with barbecue grill, tables and all the necessary utensils to prepare a delicious barbecue. The space must be reserved in advance and is subject to a usage fee. We can provide local meat cuts if desired.

1.title: Itaimbezinho Canyon: Complete Guide for Your Visit
1.excerpt: Discover everything about the famous Itaimbezinho Canyon, one of the main attractions of Cambará do Sul. Trail tips, schedules and how to make the most of your visit.
1.content:
Itaimbezinho Canyon is one of Brazil's most impressive natural wonders, located in Aparados da Serra National Park. With its 5.8 km extension and up to 720 meters deep, it offers spectacular views that leave any visitor speechless.

To reach the canyon, you can choose from different trails. The Vertex Trail is the most popular and accessible, with only 1.4 km of light walking, ideal for the whole family. The Bridal Veil Waterfall Trail offers a more adventurous experience, with 3 km of hiking that leads to one of the most beautiful waterfalls in the region.

The park operates Tuesday to Sunday, from 8am to 5pm. We recommend arriving early to avoid crowds and enjoy the best light for photography. Don't forget to bring water, sunscreen and wear appropriate hiking shoes.

Admission costs R$ 17 for adults and is free for children up to 11 years old and seniors over 60. Parking is free and is just a few meters from the park entrance.

2.title: Where to Eat in Cambará do Sul: Must-Visit Restaurants
2.excerpt: Discover the best types of restaurants in Cambará do Sul, from traditional gaucho cuisine to vegetarian options. Flavors that perfectly complement your trip.
2.content:
The gastronomy of Cambará do Sul is a chapter apart in the experience of visiting the region. The city offers everything from traditional gaucho restaurants to more contemporary options, always valuing local ingredients from the gaucho highlands.

Restaurants specializing in traditional barbecue are a trademark of the region. You'll find establishments that serve roasted lamb, ribs cooked over an open fire and other specialties of gaucho cuisine. The rustic and welcoming atmosphere is characteristic of these places.

For those seeking a more refined experience, there are restaurants that offer regional cuisine dishes with contemporary touches. Many of them take advantage of the privileged location to offer meals with views of the mountains and canyons.

Vegetarians and vegans also find good options in the city. Several establishments serve natural and organic dishes, in addition to offering traditional colonial cafes from the mountain region.

Don't forget to try local specialties like pine nuts (typical of winter), artisanal cheeses from the region, wild honey and wines produced in Serra Gaúcha. Many restaurants offer tastings of these typical products, especially during colonial breakfast.

3.title: Cambará do Sul Winter Festival 2024
3.excerpt: The traditional Winter Festival is coming! Check out the complete program with shows, gastronomy and activities for the whole family during the month of July.
3.content:
The Cambará do Sul Winter Festival is one of the most anticipated events of the year in the region. Throughout the month of July, the city transforms into a great cultural stage, offering a diverse program for all tastes.

This year, the festival will feature shows by national and regional artists, folk dance presentations, local art exhibitions and a gastronomic fair with the best of mountain cuisine.

Among the program highlights are gaucho music shows at the city's natural amphitheater, German dance presentations that celebrate the region's cultural heritage, and local craft workshops.

The gastronomic fair will operate every weekend of the month, offering everything from typical gaucho dishes to vegetarian and vegan options. Don't miss the opportunity to try the famous "mountain quentão" and colonial sweets.

For children, there will be special activities such as painting workshops, storytelling and theatrical presentations. The event is free and takes place at various points in the city.

We recommend making advance reservations at inns, as July is high season in the region due to the festival and winter holidays.

4.title: The History of Canyons: How These Wonders Were Formed
4.excerpt: Understand the fascinating geological process that gave rise to the canyons of Cambará do Sul millions of years ago. A journey through time through science.
4.content:
The canyons of Cambará do Sul are the result of a fascinating geological process that began more than 130 million years ago. Their formation is intimately linked to the separation of the South American and African continents.

It all began during the Cretaceous period, when intense volcanic activities covered the region with thick layers of basalt. These volcanic rocks formed what we now know as the Serra Geral Plateau.

The process of canyon formation proper began about 10 million years ago, when climatic and tectonic changes caused the region to rise. Rivers that once flowed peacefully over the plateau began to deeply carve the basaltic rocks.

Differential erosion was fundamental in this process. The more resistant layers of basalt formed the vertical walls of the canyons, while the softer rocks were carried away by the waters, creating the deep valleys we see today.

Itaimbezinho Canyon, for example, was sculpted mainly by the Rio do Boi, which over millions of years carved a gorge up to 720 meters deep. The waterfalls we see today are the result of this continuous erosion process.

This unique geological formation makes the canyons of Cambará do Sul true open-air museums, where we can observe millions of years of Earth's history engraved in the rocks.

5.title: Bridal Veil Waterfall Trail: Adventure Guaranteed
5.excerpt: One of the most beautiful trails in the region leads to the impressive Bridal Veil Waterfall. Learn how to prepare for this unforgettable adventure.
5.content:
The Bridal Veil Waterfall Trail is considered one of the most beautiful and challenging in Cambará do Sul. With approximately 3 km in length (one way), the trail offers spectacular landscapes and ends at one of the most impressive waterfalls in the region.

The trail starts near the city center and has a moderate difficulty level. The route takes approximately 2 hours to complete (one way), passing through different types of vegetation typical of the mountain region.

Along the way, you'll cross crystal-clear streams, walk through sections of native forest and have panoramic views of the fields and hills characteristic of the region. It's important to wear appropriate hiking shoes, as some sections can be slippery, especially after rain.

Bridal Veil Waterfall has an impressive drop and forms a natural pool at the base, where you can cool off (when weather conditions permit). The waterfall's name comes from the format of its water drop, which resembles a fluttering bridal veil.

Important recommendations: bring enough water, sunscreen, repellent and snacks. The trail has no support structure along the route, so it's essential to be well prepared. It's always recommended to inform someone about your itinerary and expected return time.

The best time to do the trail is during the drier months (April to September), when chances of rain are lower and visibility is better.

6.title: Climate in Cambará do Sul: What to Expect in Each Season
6.excerpt: Plan your trip by knowing the climate of Cambará do Sul throughout the year. Tips on when to visit and what to pack for each season.
6.content:
The climate of Cambará do Sul is humid subtropical, with well-defined characteristics in each season of the year. Understanding these variations is fundamental to planning your trip and making the most of the region.

In summer (December to March), temperatures vary between 15°C and 28°C. It's the rainiest time of the year, with frequent afternoon rains. Despite this, it's an excellent time to visit waterfalls and do trails in the morning. Bring light clothes, raincoat and waterproof shoes.

Autumn (March to June) is considered one of the best times to visit the region. Temperatures stay between 8°C and 22°C, with less rain and sunnier days. The vegetation colors are especially beautiful at this time. It's ideal for all outdoor activities.

Winter (June to September) is the coldest season, with temperatures between 2°C and 18°C. Frost can occur and, in exceptional years, even snow. It's the driest time of the year, perfect for trails and canyon tours. Visibility is usually excellent. Bring warm clothes, including waterproof jackets.

Spring (September to December) brings nature's rebirth, with temperatures between 10°C and 25°C. Rains gradually return, but there are still many sunny days. It's a beautiful time for photography, with wildflowers coloring the landscape.

Regardless of the season, always bring sunscreen, as the altitude (about 1000m) intensifies UV rays. Layered clothing is always a good option due to temperature variations.
